author: jimmygchen
content:
<@564345498471759890> re metrics unit seconds vs milliseconds - prometheus libraries  use `seconds` as standard unit for timer metrics - it does supports decimals (`float64`) - so I think we should stick with seconds?

https://github.com/prometheus/docs/blob/main/content/docs/instrumenting/writing_clientlibs.md#histogram

> Some way to time code for users in seconds. In Python this is the time() decorator/context manager. In Java this is startTimer/observeDuration. **Units other than seconds MUST NOT be offered** (if a user wants something else, they can do it by hand). This should follow the same pattern as Gauge/Summary.
